message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We used a combination of the Demographic and Health Survey (DHS) data, Global Burden of Disease (GBD) data, and World Health Organization (WHO) data to estimate the burden of malnutrition among children aged 0-59 months in Sub-Saharan African countries.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Survey (DHS)", "Global Burden of Disease (GBD)", "World Health Organization (WHO)"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the Doing Business report and IP statistics from national patent offices, we investigate the relationship between business registration processes and innovation outcomes across different countries.", "dataset": ["Doing Business report", "IP statistics from national patent offices"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "This paper estimates the impact of early childhood education on cognitive development using longitudinal data from the Young Lives study, which tracks the lives of children from four low- and middle-income countries at different stages of their lives.", "dataset": ["Young Lives study"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "To explore the impact of climate change on agricultural productivity, we merge satellite-derived environmental data, crop yield data from the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO), and household survey data from the Living Standards Measurement Study - Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA).", "dataset": ["satellite-derived environmental data", "crop yield data from the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO)", "household survey data from the Living Standards Measurement Study - Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Environment", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We combined household budget survey data from the National Statistical Offices in seven Asian countries with production and price data from agricultural censuses and other sources to estimate the poverty impacts of agricultural development policies.", "dataset": ["household budget survey data from the National Statistical Offices in seven Asian countries", "production and price data from agricultural censuses"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the International Energy Agency (IEA), we examine the effects of energy efficiency measures on economic growth and greenhouse gas emissions in G20 countries.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency (IEA)"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze household survey data, traffic counts, and air pollution measurements to study the relationship between transportation infrastructure and welfare outcomes in urban areas.", "dataset": ["household survey data", "traffic counts", "air pollution measurements"], "topic": ["Transport", "Urban Development"]}, {"sentence": "In this study, we use data from the World Bank's Doing Business report, the Global Investment Competitiveness Survey, and firm-level data to explore the relationship between business environment and investment flows across different countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Doing Business report", "Global Investment Competitiveness Survey", "firm-level data"], "topic": ["Investment", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We examine the impact of social protection programs on poverty reduction using household survey data from eight African countries and administrative data on program beneficiaries.", "dataset": ["household survey data from eight African countries", "administrative data on program beneficiaries"], "topic": ["Poverty", "Social Protection"]}, {"sentence": "To investigate the drivers of deforestation in the Amazon region, we combine satellite images, land tenure data, and municipality-level socioeconomic data.", "dataset": ["satellite images", "land tenure data", "municipality-level socioeconomic data"], "topic": ["Environment", "Extractive Industries"]}]
